identifier.value: Long Term Care Hospital (LTCH) Continuity Assessment Record and Evaluation (CARE) Data Set

text.div:
LCDS_LU standard form version 4.00.

Long-Term Care Hospitals (LTCHs) report data to meet Long -Term Care Hospital (LTCH) Quality Reporting Program (QRP) requirements.

name: LCDS_LU
publisher: Division of Chronic and Post Acute Care
title: Long Term Care Hospital (LTCH) Continuity Assessment Record and Evaluation (CARE) Data Set - LCDS Unplanned Discharge
description: Long-Term Care Hospitals (LTCHs) report data to meet Long -Term Care Hospital (LTCH) Quality Reporting Program (QRP) requirements.

item.text: Section A: Administrative Information

code.display: LCDS v4.00 - Administrative information - discharge [CMS Assessment]

item.text: Type of Provider
Medicaid Number - Enter "+" if pending, "N" if not a Medicaid recipient
Gender
Birth Date
Type of Record
Reason for Assessment
Admission Date
Discharge Location

valueCoding.display: Community residential setting (e.g., private home/apt., board/care, assisted living, group home, adult foster care)
Community residential setting (e.g., private home, assisted living, group home, adult foster care)

item.text: Assessment Reference Date. Observation end date
Discharge Date
Facility Provider Numbers
National Provider Identifier (NPI)
CMS Certification Number (CCN)
State Medicaid {Facility/Provider} Number
Legal Name of {Patient/Resident}
First name
Middle initial
Last name
Suffix

Social Security Number
Medicare number
Race/Ethnicity: Check all that apply

valueCoding.display: Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander
Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander

item.text: Payer Information: Check all that apply

valueCoding.display: Title programs (e.g., Title III, V, or XX)
Title programs (e.g., Title III, V, or XX)

item.text: Section B: Hearing, Speech, and Vision
Section C: Cognitive Patterns
Alert (Normal)
Vigilant (hyperalert) or Lethargic (drowsy, easily aroused) or Stupor (difficulty to arouse) or Coma (unarousable)
Signs and Symptoms of Delirium (from CAM©). Confusion Assessment Method (CAM©) Shortened Version Worksheet
Is there evidence of an acute change in mental status from the {patient's/resident's} baseline?
Did the (abnormal) behavior fluctuate during the day, that is, tend to come and go or increase and decrease in severity?
Did the {patient/resident} have difficulty focusing attention, for example, being easily distractible or having difficulty keeping track of what was being said?

Was the {patient's/resident's} thinking disorganized or incoherent, such as rambling or irrelevant conversation, unclear or illogical flow of ideas, or unpredictable, switching from subject to subject?
Overall, how would you rate the {patient's/resident's} level of consciousness?
Section GG: Functional Abilities and Goals
Section H: Bladder and Bowel
Section I: Active Diagnoses
Section J: Health Conditions

code.display: Health conditions - discharge or expired [CMS Assessment]

item.text: Has the {patient/resident} had any falls since {admission}?
Number of Falls Since {Admission} or Prior Assessment whichever is most recent

No injury - No evidence of any injury is noted on physical assessment by the nurse or primary care clinician; no complaints of pain or injury by the {patient/resident}; no change in the {patient's/resident's} behavior is noted after the fall.
Injury (except major) - Skin tears, abrasions, lacerations, superficial bruises, hematomas and sprains; or any fall-related injury that causes the {patient/resident} to complain of pain
Major injury - Bone fractures, joint dislocations, closed head injuries with altered consciousness, subdural hematoma
Section K: Swallowing/Nutritional Status
Section M: Skin Conditions

code.display: LCDS v4.00 - Skin conditions - discharge [CMS Assessment]

item.text: Unhealed Pressure Ulcers/Injuries. Does this {patient/resident} have one or more unhealed pressure ulcers/injuries?
Number of Stage 2 pressure ulcers
Number of these Stage 2 pressure ulcers that were present upon {admission} - enter how many were noted at the time of {admission}
Number of Stage 3 pressure ulcers
Number of these Stage 3 pressure ulcers that were present upon {admission} - enter how many were noted at the time of {admission}
Number of Stage 4 pressure ulcers
Number of these Stage 4 pressure ulcers that were present upon {admission} - enter how many were noted at the time of {admission}
Number of unstageable pressure ulcers/injuries due to non-removable dressing/device
Number of these unstageable pressure ulcers/injuries that were present upon {admission} - enter how many were noted at the time of {admission}
Number of unstageable pressure ulcers due to coverage of wound bed by slough and/or eschar
Number of these unstageable pressure ulcers that were present upon {admission} - enter how many were noted at the time of {admission}
Number of unstageable pressure injuries presenting as deep tissue injury
Number of these unstageable pressure injuries that were present upon {admission} - enter how many were noted at the time of {admission}
Current Number of Unhealed Pressure Ulcers/Injuries at Each Stage

Stage 1: Intact skin with non-blanchable redness of a localized area usually over a bony prominence. Darkly pigmented skin may not have a visible blanching; in dark skin tones only it may appear with persistent blue or purple hues
Stage 2: Partial thickness loss of dermis presenting as a shallow open ulcer with a red or pink wound bed, without slough. May also present as an intact or open/ruptured blister.

Stage 3: Full thickness tissue loss. Subcutaneous fat may be visible but bone, tendon or muscle is not exposed. Slough may be present but does not obscure the depth of tissue loss. May include undermining and tunneling
Stage 4: Full thickness tissue loss with exposed bone, tendon or muscle. Slough or eschar may be present on some parts of the wound bed. Often includes undermining and tunneling
Unstageable - Non-removable dressing/device: Known but not stageable due to non-removable dressing/device
Unstageable - Slough and/or eschar: Known but not stageable due to coverage of wound bed by slough and/or eschar
Unstageable - Deep tissue injury
Number of Stage 1 pressure injuries
Section N: Medications

code.display: LCDS, IRF-PAI - Medications - discharge and expired [CMS Assessment]

item.text: Medication Intervention. Did the {facility/setting} contact and complete physician (or physician-designee) prescribed/recommended actions by midnight of the next calendar day each time potential clinically significant medication issues were identified since the {admission}?

valueCoding.display: Not applicable - There were no potential clinically significant medication issues identified since {admission} or {patient/resident} is not taking any medications
NA - There were no potential clinically significant medication issues identified since admission or patient is not taking any medications

item.text: Section O: Special Treatments, Procedures, and Programs

code.display: LCDS v4.0 - Special treatments, procedures, and programs - discharge [CMS Assessment]

item.text: Influenza Vaccine - Refer to the current version of the {manual} for current influenza vaccination season and reporting period
Did the {patient/resident} receive the influenza vaccine in this {facility/setting} for this year's influenza vaccination season?
Date influenza vaccine received
If influenza vaccine not received, state reason

valueCoding.display: {Patient/resident} not in facility during this year's influenza vaccination season
Patient not in this facility during this year's influenza vaccination season
Inability to obtain influenza vaccine due to a declared shortage
Inability to obtain influenza vaccine due to a declared shortage

item.text: Special Treatments, Procedures, and Programs. Check all of the following treatments, procedures, and programs that were performed

valueCoding.display: IV medications, (if checked, please specify below)
Vasoactive medications (i.e., continuous infusions of vasopressors or inotropes)
Vasoactive medications (i.e., continuous infusions of vasopressors or inotropes)

item.text: Ventilator Liberation Rate
Invasive Mechanical Ventilator: Liberation Status at Discharge

valueCoding.display: Not fully liberated at discharge (i.e., {patient/resident} required partial or full invasive mechanical ventilation support within 2 calendar days prior to discharge)
Not fully liberated at discharge (i.e., patient required partial or full invasive mechanical ventilation support within 2 calendar days prior to discharge)
Fully liberated at discharge (i.e., {patient/resident} did not require any invasive mechanical ventilation support for at least 2 consecutive calendar days immediately prior to discharge)
Fully liberated at discharge (i.e., patient did not require any invasive mechanical ventilation support for at least 2 consecutive calendar days immediately prior to discharge)
Not applicable (Code only if the {patient/resident} was not on an invasive mechanical ventilator support upon admission or the {patient/resident} was determined to be non-weaning upon admission)
